articles.author: Tatiana Bautzer, Saeed Azhar, Lananh Nguyen
articles.description: As Citigroup (C.N) embarks on a sweeping reorganization, support staff in compliance and risk management are among the most likely to lose their jobs, according to sources familiar with the situation.
articles.title: Citigroup starts layoff talks after management overhaul -sources

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's central bank rolled over maturing medium-term policy loans while keeping the interest rate on them unchanged on Friday, boosting liquidity after a similar move the previous day.
articles.title: China boosts liquidity with medium-term policy tool

articles.author: Biplob Das
articles.description: India's largest winemaker, Sula Vineyards (SULA.NS), is expanding its production capacity and counting on a pricing sweet spot to fend off foreign rivals in its home turf.
articles.title: Indian winemaker Sula not losing sleep over foreign rivals - CEO

articles.author: Kevin Buckland
articles.description: Asian stocks rose strongly on Friday, extending a global equity rally, after better-than-expected Chinese economic data added to the good vibes from expectations that tightening campaigns by the world's biggest central banks were close to over.
articles.title: Asia stocks rally as China data buoys mood; dollar stays strong

articles.author: Dawn Chmielewski
articles.description: Thirty-one years ago, cable TV pioneer John Malone predicted customers would have as many as 500 channels in their living rooms.
articles.title: Disney, Charter’s Spectrum deal will reshape media -executives

articles.author: Norihiko Shirouzu
articles.description: Tesla (TSLA.O) has combined a series of innovations to make a technological breakthrough that could transform the way it makes electric vehicles and help Elon Musk achieve his aim of halving production costs, five people familiar with the move said.
articles.title: Gigacasting 2.0: Tesla reinvents carmaking with quiet breakthrough

articles.author: Daina Beth Solomon
articles.description: Amazon (AMZN.O) on Thursday inaugurated its largest last-mile delivery center in Latin America, a warehouse in Mexico's capital, as it seeks to offer faster deliveries in one of the region's most populous cities.
articles.title: Amazon opens its biggest last-mile delivery center in Latin America

articles.author: Joseph White
articles.description: The United Auto Workers (UAW) union said on Thursday workers would walk off the job at three Detroit Three factories at midnight, barring a last-minute agreement, setting up the most ambitious U.S. industrial labor action in decades.
articles.title: U.S. auto workers target Detroit Three plants for historic strike

articles.author: Ellen Zhang, Joe Cash
articles.description: China's industrial output and retail sales grew at a faster-than-expected pace in August, but property investment slumped further and could drag on broader demand even as the recent flurry of support policies showed signs of stabilising the economy.
articles.title: China factory output, retail sales beat forecasts in boost to recovery prospects

articles.author: Paul Mathiasen
articles.description: Hundreds of Haitians returned from the Dominican Republic on Thursday after the Dominican president announced an imminent total border shutdown amid a conflict over the construction of a water channel from a shared river.
articles.title: Hundreds leave Dominican Republic ahead of Haiti border shutdown
